docs.lead_paragraph: More than half of privately insured women are getting free birth control under President Barack Obama's health law, a major coverage shift that's likely to advance.

headline.main: Free Birth Control Is Emerging Standard for Women
headline.print_headline: Free Birth Control Is Emerging Standard for Women

docs.snippet: More than half of privately insured women are getting free birth control under President Barack Obama's health law, a major coverage shift that's likely to advance.

docs.lead_paragraph: Vaccination prices have risen significantly over the past 30 years, creating dilemmas for physicians and parents and straining public health budgets.

headline.main: The Price of Prevention: Vaccine Costs Are Soaring
headline.print_headline: The Price of Prevention: Vaccine Costs Soaring

docs.abstract: Vaccination prices have gone from single digits to sometimes triple digits in the last two decades; situation is creating dilemmas for doctors and their patients as well as straining public health budgets; childhood immunizations are so vital to public health that Affordable Care Act mandates their coverage at no out-of-pocket cost; once a loss leader for manufacturers, vaccines now can be very profitable (Series: Paying Till It Hurts).
docs.snippet: Vaccination prices have risen significantly over the past 30 years, creating dilemmas for physicians and parents and straining public health budgets.

headline.main: I Couldn't Turn My Abortion Into Art

docs.abstract: I believed completely in a woman’s right to choose, but I didn’t know what a brutal choice it was.
docs.snippet: I believed completely in a woman’s right to choose, but I didn’t know what a brutal choice it was.

docs.lead_paragraph: Business owners who don't want to pay for their employees' birth control are ending that coverage after the Supreme Court said they could choose on grounds of religious belief not to comply with part of the health care law.

headline.main: Ruling Won't Alter Birth-Control Coverage for Many
headline.print_headline: Ruling Won't Alter Birth-Control Coverage for Many

docs.snippet: Business owners who don't want to pay for their employees' birth control are ending that coverage after the Supreme Court said they could choose on grounds of religious belief not to comply with part of the health care law.

headline.main: China Sees Long Road to Cleaning Up Pollution

docs.abstract: A state-run newspaper says it will take at least 16 years for China to attain safe levels of dangerous particulate matter in its air, but even that is in doubt.
docs.snippet: A state-run newspaper says it will take at least 16 years for China to attain safe levels of dangerous particulate matter in its air, but even that is in doubt.

docs.lead_paragraph: Neil Genzlinger takes a look at the runaway research on the effects of television viewing.

headline.seo: Why the Research on Viewing Is Best Ignored
headline.main: Please Tune Out Those TV Studies
headline.print_headline: Please Tune Out Those TV Studies

docs.abstract: Neil Genzlinger Critic's Notebook questions validity of American Heart Association study asserting that watching too much television increases risk of early death in adults; points to changing nature of health pronouncements; argues death warning masks more complicated picture, and notes that some studies have shown benefits associated with television viewing.
docs.snippet: Neil Genzlinger takes a look at the runaway research on the effects of television viewing.

docs.lead_paragraph: A North Carolina teenager appears to have concealed her pregnancy from her parents before giving birth to a baby girl whose body was found buried in the family's yard, local police said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Baby Birthed by Teenage Mother Found Buried in North Carolina: Police
headline.print_headline: Baby Birthed by Teenage Mother Found Buried in North Carolina: Police

docs.snippet: A North Carolina teenager appears to have concealed her pregnancy from her parents before giving birth to a baby girl whose body was found buried in the family's yard, local police said on Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: A 16-year-old girl appears to have hidden her pregnancy from her parents for nine months and given birth without their knowledge to a baby girl who was found buried in the family's backyard, a North Carolina sheriff said Tuesday.

headline.main: Sheriff: NC Teen Hid Her Pregnancy From Parents
headline.print_headline: Sheriff: NC Teen Hid Her Pregnancy From Parents

docs.snippet: A 16-year-old girl appears to have hidden her pregnancy from her parents for nine months and given birth without their knowledge to a baby girl who was found buried in the family's backyard, a North Carolina sheriff said Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Supreme Court agreed on Tuesday to hear a case that would determine whether UPS Inc treated a pregnant employee unfairly by denying her request for temporary restrictions on her work duties.

headline.main: U.S. Top Court to Hear Pregnant Worker's Appeal Against UPS
headline.print_headline: U.S. Top Court to Hear Pregnant Worker's Appeal Against UPS

docs.snippet: The U.S. Supreme Court agreed on Tuesday to hear a case that would determine whether UPS Inc treated a pregnant employee unfairly by denying her request for temporary restrictions on her work duties.
